pageContext.markings:
Reverse of the support:
a handwritten text in blackish brown ink, name in gold (faded), attached later, at the bottom only fragmentary remains, records the dates of Elector Johann Friedrich I

[Hoffmann, Cat. Weimar 1990, 138]

tests.text: - the decorative elements as well as the signature executed in shell-gold

- original
- gilded, the recesses are indicated with stripes: on the left and at the bottom with light yellowish grey highlights and on the right and the top with black shadows
- the gilding is abraded
 
 
[Hoffmann, Cat. Weimar 1992, 136]

pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia left above the shoulder: winged serpent with dropped wings, facing right and dated '1561'; in shell-gold
[Hoffmann, Cat. Weimar 1992, 136]
